title: Blotter: ‘Deceptive’ license plate leads to arrests
content:
A 23-year-old woman and a 29-year-old man were arrested early Tuesday morning after police found a “deceptive” license plate at the Valero convenience store in the 700 block of Fort Worth Drive.
The report did not elaborate on the details of the license plate. Police were initially called to the scene at 4:49 a.m. to investigate a domestic disturbance.
Officers were told that someone broke a car window with a rock. But when they arrived, they determined the subjects acted in self defense, and no charges were filed for that report.
Police later arrested the 23-year-old woman on four outstanding warrants from the Tool Police Department, located south of Dallas. Her charges included failure to maintain financial responsibility, speeding, failure to appear in court and a violation of a promise to appear. The man was charged with the manufacture or sale of a deceptive license plate.
The online report did not indicate why or how police came upon the two suspects, who were taken to Denton City Jail.
Other reports
700 block of Interstate 35 East — A 55-year-old man was hospitalized Tuesday night after accidentally shooting himself in the leg in front of the Applebee’s in the 700 block of South Interstate 35 East.
His wife, who initially called police at 8:12 p.m., said her husband had been trying to put the gun away when it fired. Police arrived on the scene and placed a tourniquet on the man’s leg before he was taken to a nearby hospital.
His current condition is unknown.
1700 block of Carlton Street — A caller told police on Tuesday afternoon that a 15-year-old girl locked herself in a bathroom and drank bleach during a fight with her mother.
Officers responded to the call at about 1 p.m. and were able to gain access to the bathroom, according to a police report. Paramedics quickly took the girl to a nearby hospital for treatment and a mental health screening, the report said. No arrests were made, and her condition is unknown.
700 block of Londonderry Lane — A 27-year-old man’s motorcycle was reportedly stolen sometime between Sunday and Tuesday afternoon at the Londonderry Oaks Apartment. No arrests have been made.
Roundup
From 7 a.m. Tuesday to 7 a.m. Wednesday:
Denton County Sheriff’s Office dispatchers handled 743 service and officer-initiated calls for the agencies they serve, and 40 people were booked into Denton County Jail.
Denton police posted 18 reports online.
Denton firefighters responded to 26 medical calls, one vehicle accident and one call for public service.
— Julian Gill
